official-title.#text:
To authorize the Secretary of Transportation to establish
		  a program to make grants to ports to enable ports to employ high school
		  students during the summer.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Port Opportunity Reinvestment and
			 Training Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(in this
			 Act referred to as the

, the authority in charge of a port
			 shall submit an application at such time, in such form, and with such
			 information and assurances as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Port Opportunity Reinvestment and Training Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may require, including an assurance
			 that no worker will be displaced or terminated because of the creation of
			 temporary summer employment for students.

text.#text:
In order to receive a grant under the
			 program established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall give priority to a port located in a city with a high rate of
			 unemployment, and shall also consider—

text.#text:
In
			 considering applications for a grant under this section and in determining the
			 grant amount for each port awarded a grant under this section, the

the cargo volume
			 of the port; and

the size of the
			 surrounding city.

Amounts awarded under
			 this section shall not exceed $1,000,000 per port per fiscal year.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may require.
			 The authority in charge of the port shall return any amounts awarded but not

at the end of the grant period.

text.#text:
A grant awarded under this section shall be for a 1-year
			 period and may be renewed based on such criteria as the

A port receiving a grant
			 under this section shall use such funds to—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in which the port is located; and

text.#text:
live within the
			 Metropolitan Statistical Area, as defined by the

compensate the
			 student employees in accordance with applicable State and Federal wage
			 statutes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 provided that no more than 15 percent of the students’ time may be spent on
			 such training, and the students are compensated at their normal rate of pay for
			 participation in such training.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Port Opportunity Reinvestment and Training Act of 2013/s:2/ss:f/p:1

text.#text:
A port receiving a grant under this section may use such
			 funds to provide job training for student employees described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Port Opportunity Reinvestment and Training Act of 2013/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text:
such sums as may be necessary for each of
			 fiscal years 2014 through 2016
